title: How to get more than 85% in 10th (RBSE, Rajasthan Board) - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: To score more than 85% in RBSE Class X, you need to be extremely focused. What you need is not a stringent timetable but effective time management. For Preparations: Plan well. Study different topics according to their difficulty levels;Make a list of all Maths formulae and keep it on your study table for repetitive revision;Self study (Do lots of practice to achieve proficiency in Maths);Try to solve RBSE practice papers and sample papers within three hours (time management is must);If finding difficulty in solving problems of a particular topic, give thorough revision to that specific topic and take help from your teacher;Sleep well on the night before the exam to keep the mind and body relaxed.On the day of exam: Review all the formulae and important topics early in the morning;Be confident and keep a positive attitudeDuring Exam: In the first 15 minutes allotted as reading time, wisely select the appropriate question to be solved in which internal choices have been provided to avoid wastage of time later;Write neatly with proper margins (presentation matters too);Do not get stuck to a question for a long time, if unable to solve, leave space for it and move on to the next question;Even if the complete solution to a particular question is not known, try to write till the known steps;Leave at least 10 minutes for revision of answer sheets.Let me give you tips subject wise: English Read the chapters before they are taught in the classPractice grammar and letter writingTextbooks are more than enough, but if you still need a guide, buy Full Marks guideRead novels.Read The Hindu newspaper dailyImprove your reading speed. They will come handy when you attempt reading passages.Hindi Well, I used Golden Hindi guide. It is good.Same as English, practice writing skills and grammar regularlyImprove your reading speedMemorize the meaning of each line of every archaic poem. You have no other choice in this.Science Practice numericals EVERYDAY. NCERT numericals are not enough. Go for Together With guide.Your basics should be clearMemorize chemistry formulas by writing a lot. There is no other way.Do well in your practicals. They will help you to understand the concept better.There are many good learning resources on the internet like Byju’s and ExamFear. Use them liberally.Social Science Well, Social Science was my favorite subject and one of my strengths. There is absolutely NO NEED to buy any guides. NCERT textbooks are more than enough.Practice map marking regularly.Jot down important points of each chapter.Memorize facts by writing them down. Social Science is mostly about memorizing.Mathematics Practice sums DAILY. Buy RD Sharma. It has many types of numericals and it’s basics are goodNever attempt to read mathematics. It can’t be memorized. It only requires understanding.You should be quick and correct while attempting sums. Never spend a lot of time on any sum (especially one mark questions)Sharpen your skills in basic mathematical operations like addition, division, subtraction etc.Give more importance to topics like Triangles, Trigonometry, Algebra. They require more practice. At the same time, don’t neglect other topics.Never get scared of maths. After all, it is just playing with numbers.I have explained everything in detail. First of all I want to say that 10th board is not big challenge if you will do study hard. I passed my 12th last year now i am in 1st year. I want to tell you that how I did study in my 12th board from goverment school with rbse board without any coching and how I got 83.20% just near to 85%. If you want then you can take this method in your study because 10th and 12th boards are equal. I also did my schooling from rbse board. I started my study from the month of Jun. every day I make task for that day. On Sunday I revise all that lesson which I read in a week. On last day of month I revise all that lesson which I read in a month. Till 15 January I revised my whole course 4 or 5 times. In month of January books of important question comes in market. I preferd RBD, desk work etc. Make the time table as your comfortable.Do study at least 5 hours in a day.Keep revising whole course 4 or 5 times till january.Make tricks for learn.In middle of January many books comes in market which have important questions for board exam you can revise them.Understand things don't cram all things.In February do model paper as a board exam and see what mistake you are doing then correct it. You can take model paper from desk work.Make a strategy for exam.I followed this strategy in my 12th class. Now its on you that how you will use your mind and get good marks in 10th board.
